intro: Neobartsia aprica, commonly known as the golden bartsia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its small, showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters during the spring and summer seasons. Its leaves are opposite and often have a slightly hairy texture. Neobartsia aprica typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forest floors or along stream banks.
